marketNews.title: The Fed Projects Fewer Interest Rate Cuts in 2025
marketNews.content: The Fed cut the benchmark interest rate by 25bps to the 4.25-4.50% level on Wednesday (19/12) local time. This decision was in line with consensus expectations. This cut is the third this year with a total cut of 100bps. Nevertheless, the Fed projects fewer interest rate cuts next year due to slow progress in inflation reduction and caution regarding uncertainty about the US President-elect's policy, Trump. The Fed estimates inflation in 2025 will be at the 2.5% level, higher than the previous estimate of 2.1%. Thus, the Fed only sees interest rate cuts of 50bps (2x25bps) in 2025, lower than the previous projection released in September 2024 of 100bps. Responding to this latest projection, the US stock market weakened, followed by a rise in bond yields and the US dollar index in trading on Wednesday (18/12) local time. - S&P 500 -2.95% - Nasdaq -3.56% - DJIA -2.65% - DXY +1% - UST 10Y +11.5bps. The Indonesian capital market also weakened in today's trading (19/12). IHSG fell -1.84% with the benchmark government bond yield for the 10-year tenor rising +43 bps to the 7.10% level. The Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar weakened -1.24% to the 16,290 level.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The prospect of fewer interest rate cuts by the Fed could limit the room for Bank Indonesia to cut rates. As of Thursday (19/12), the consensus compiled by Bloomberg still projects Bank Indonesia to cut interest rates by ~75bps in 2025. Amid market volatility, this moment can be utilized by investors to buy government bonds FR with higher yields. We favor the PBS032 series (maturing in ~1.5 years) which offers a yield of 6.93%, as of Thursday (19/12). Short-term FR bonds have relatively lower volatility risk compared to long-term FR bonds, especially if there is uncertainty regarding the timing and amount of interest rate cuts.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Pledges Pardon for Corruptors Who Return Stolen Assets
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto said on Wednesday (18/12) that he might pardon corruptors if they return what they stole. President Prabowo did not provide details about this plan, but he said that his administration might provide a way for corruptors to secretly return what they have stolen. Based on the 2023 Corruption Perception Index from Transparency International, Indonesia only scored 34 out of 100, indicating that Indonesia has serious problems related to corruption.

marketNews.title: US President-elect Trump Rejects Bipartisan Budget, Demands Debt Ceiling Hike
marketNews.content: US President-elect Donald Trump rejected the bipartisan budget being discussed by parliament on Wednesday (18/12) and demanded an increase in the national debt ceiling before he takes office next month. The cancellation of the bipartisan budget—which includes $100.4 billion in disaster aid, economic assistance for struggling farmers, funding to rebuild the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, and a pay raise for parliament members—could trigger a US federal government shutdown as early as Saturday (21/12), disrupting all activities in the US from air travel to law enforcement ahead of the Christmas holidays. If realized, this would mark the first US government shutdown since late December 2018 to early 2019, when Trump served his first term. Trump threatened that Republican parliament members who support the bipartisan budget would struggle to get re-elected because they would face challenges within the party.

marketNews.title: Bappenas Targets High Economic Growth and Investment Realization for 2025-2029 Period
marketNews.content: Expert staff at the Ministry of National Development Planning/National Development Agency (Bappenas), Rd Siliwanti, stated that Bappenas targets Indonesian economic growth to reach +5.3% in 2025, +6.3% in 2026, +7.5% in 2027, +7.7% in 2028, and +8% in 2029. This target is much higher compared to the World Bank's outlook which estimates Indonesian economic growth to only reach +5.1% in 2025-2026 and +5% in 2027, or the International Monetary Fund's projection which estimates Indonesian economic growth will stagnate at the +5.1% level from 2025 to 2029. To achieve this target, Bappenas targets total investment realization of 47,587.3 trillion rupiah during 2025-2029 or equivalent to 9,517 trillion rupiah per year. For comparison, the government only targeted investment realization of 1,906 trillion rupiah in 2025.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia to Purchase Rp150 Trillion of Government Bonds in Secondary Market in 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said on Wednesday (18/12) that Bank Indonesia will purchase Indonesian government bonds worth 150 trillion rupiah in the secondary market in 2025, an amount that may increase. This purchase plan is larger than the government bonds maturing in 2025 worth 100 trillion rupiah, which is part of the bonds under the burden sharing scheme between the government and Bank Indonesia to finance the burden incurred during the Covid-19 era.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Governor Pledges Cooperation in CSR Fund Corruption Probe
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo, on Wednesday (18/12), pledged to cooperate with the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) in the investigation of corruption involving corporate social responsibility (CSR) funds at the central bank. Perry stated that the market will monitor the development of this corruption case, where every piece of news will affect market conditions and the exchange rate. Despite the corruption issue, Perry mentioned that Bank Indonesia remains committed to maintaining exchange rate stability through market intervention. Previously, the KPK conducted a search at the Bank Indonesia office on Monday (16/12) night—including Perry's office—related to the alleged misuse of CSR funds.

tickerNews.title: BBRI Director Confirms Customer Funds and Data Safe from Ransomware Attack
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia Director, Arga M. Nugraha, confirmed that customer data and funds remain safe amidst issues of a ransomware attack. Arga also mentioned that customers can continue to use all of BBRI's banking service systems normally. Arga's statement came after several accounts on social media X rumored that the bank had suffered a ransomware attack.

tickerNews.title: MDKA Records Net Loss in 3Q24 Driven by Sharp Decline in Gross Margin
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Copper Gold recorded a net loss of -54.5 million US dollars in 3Q24 (vs 2Q24: net profit 2.7 million US dollars, 3Q23: net profit 25.4 million US dollars). This resulted in MDKA's net loss for 9M24 reaching -67 million US dollars (vs 9M23: -23.8 million US dollars). This figure is below the consensus expectation for FY24F at -5.4 million US dollars. The performance decline in 3Q24 was primarily caused by a sharp drop in gross margin to 5.1% in 3Q24 (vs 2Q24: 10%, 3Q23: 11.2%) due to a sharp increase in mining costs by +42% QoQ and +45% YoY.

tickerNews.title: MBMA Net Loss in 3Q24 Pushes 9M24 Profit Below Consensus Estimates
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials recorded a net loss of 1.9 million US dollars in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: net profit 16.7 million US dollars, 3Q23: net profit 20.3 million US dollars). This result pressured net profit during 9M24 to 18.5 million US dollars (vs. 9M23: 677 thousand US dollars), below the expectation as it only reached 52% of the FY24F consensus estimate of 35.3 million US dollars. The deep performance decline in 3Q24 was mainly due to the gross margin significantly dropping to 3.5% in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: 9.5%, 3Q23: 8.2%) due to swelling mining costs by +49% QoQ and +197% YoY.

tickerNews.title: INCO Seeks US$1.2 Billion Loan for New Mine Block Development in 2025
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia Head of Corporate Communications, Vanda Kusumaningrum, stated that the company is targeting a loan of 1.2 billion US dollars to develop new mine blocks in 2025. Vanda mentioned that INCO has developed 3 new mine blocks in Pomalaa, Morowali, and Sorowako. The development of the mine block in Morowali is expected to be completed in 4Q25 and requires capital expenditure of 399 million US dollars, with an additional saprolite production capacity of 3.84 million tons per year. Meanwhile, the development of the mine block in Pomalaa requires 1 billion US dollars and is expected to start operating in 2Q26 with an annual additional production of 28.15 million saprolite and limonite. The development of the new mine block in Sorowako is expected to be completed in 3Q26 and requires an investment of around 257 million US dollars, with an expectation of an additional annual production of 11.5 million limonite.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Plans Share Buyback Up to Rp192.2 Billion
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada plans to conduct a share buyback with an allocation of funds up to 192.2 billion rupiah. ENRG stated that the number of shares to be bought back will not exceed 10% of the issued and paid-up capital. This corporate action will be carried out for 12 months since its approval at the EGM to be held on January 24, 2025.

tickerNews.title: KLBF Considers Raising Product Prices Amidst Rupiah Weakness and Upcoming VAT Hike
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma Director, Kartika Setiabudy, stated that the company is considering raising product selling prices if the pressure from the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar continues, given that the company still imports 95% of its raw materials. Kartika mentioned that they have prepared the budget for 2025 with an assumption of the Rupiah exchange rate at 16,000 per US Dollar to anticipate exchange rate volatility. On the other hand, Kartika stated that KLBF sees raw material costs stabilizing as the global supply chain has improved. Besides the exchange rate, KLBF also sees a risk of declining public consumption following the VAT increase to 12%. To maintain margins, Kartika mentioned KLBF will use a combined strategy of portfolio-mix, business-mix, and pricing.

tickerNews.title: JSMR Subsidiary Signs Rp3.96 Trillion Syndicated Loan Facility to Complete Patimban Access Toll Road
tickerNews.content: Jasa Marga, through its subsidiary, PT Jasamarga Akses Patimban, signed a syndicated loan facility worth 3.96 trillion rupiah with Bank Central Asia ($BBCA) and Sarana Multi Infrastruktur. The funds acquired are intended to complete the construction of the Patimban Access Toll Road, which is a national strategic project (PSN), with an operation target in 3Q26.

tickerNews.title: ENAK Controller Plans Voluntary Tender Offer to Increase Stake to 50.1%
tickerNews.content: The controller of Champ Resto Indonesia ($ENAK), Barokah Melayu Food Pte. Ltd., plans to conduct a voluntary tender offer for approximately 165.5 million (7.64%) ENAK shares at a price of 1,025 rupiah per share. This price is 16% higher than ENAK's share price on Thursday (19/12) at 880 rupiah per share. This plan obtained an effective statement from the OJK on December 17, 2024, after ENAK announced this corporate action plan in early August 2024. If the purchase is fully executed, Barokah Melayu Food Pte. Ltd.’s ownership in ENAK will increase from ~42.5% to 50.1%. The voluntary tender offer schedule runs from December 19, 2024, to January 17, 2025, with payment on January 30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: FITT Shareholder Jon Fieris Sells 50 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Hotel Fitra International ($FITT) shareholder, Jon Fieris, sold 50 million FITT shares at an average price of 96 rupiah per share on December 17, 2024. The total transaction value reached 4.8 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Jon Fieris's ownership in FITT decreased from 9.35% to 5.52%.

tickerNews.title: Aesler Grup Internasional RONY Controller Plans Sale of 80% Stake to Honour Accord Limited
tickerNews.content: Aesler Grup Internasional ($RONY) announced that Honour Accord Limited plans to purchase 1 billion (80%) of the company's shares from PT Nakula Investama Indonesia and PT Karimun Jawa Pratama, the current controllers of the company. The transaction value has not been announced. If this purchase plan is realized, Honour Accord Limited will become the controller of RONY.
